channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tinder explores a redesign, dating ‘modes,’ and college-specific features to boost engagement
item.description: Tinder will redesign and debut college specific features, like searching for people within the college, to appeal to younger users.

item.title: Trumpworld Knows Epstein Is a Problem. But They Can’t Solve It
item.description: Unmet expectations have pushed some of the president’s allies to the brink. “Honestly, like, fuck Trump,” a Trumpworld source who works in conservativ...

item.title: The Business Traveler of Today Is Changing—and So Is Their Flight Map
item.description: A new era of work travel is taking entrepreneurs and creatives to Nigeria, Brazil, and beyond.

item.title: Apple to announce $100B further commitment for U.S. manufacturing
item.description: This is on top of Apple's previously announced plan to invest $500 billion into the U.S. over the next four years.

item.title: The Extravagant Rise of the Corporate Incentive Trip
item.description: From skydiving trips in Dubai to Michelin-starred meals in Paris, some companies are rewarding top performers with once-in-a-lifetime travel experienc...

item.title: Citizen Lab director warns cyber industry about US authoritarian descent
item.description: Ron Deibert, the head of the prominent digital human rights groups Citizen Lab, sounds the alarm at the Black Hat security conference about the "drama...

item.title: These Democrats Think the Party Needs AI to Win Elections
item.description: The National Democratic Training Committee has made the first official playbook for the use of AI by Democratic campaigns ahead of the midterms.

item.title: Cohere’s new AI agent platform, North, promises to keep enterprise data secure

item.title: 16 Golden Rules That Business Travelers Swear By
item.description: People who constantly hit the road for work share what they wish they’d known from the jump.

item.title: Instagram takes on Snapchat with new ‘Instagram Map’
